018package org.opengis.metadata.quality;
019
020import org.opengis.util.CodeList;
021import org.opengis.annotation.UML;
022import org.opengis.geoapi.internal.Vocabulary;
023
024import static org.opengis.annotation.Obligation.*;
025import static org.opengis.annotation.Specification.*;
026
027
028/**
029 * Type of method for evaluating an identified data quality measure.
030 *
031 * @author  Martin Desruisseaux (IRD)
032 * @version 3.1
033 * @since   2.0
034 */
035@Vocabulary(capacity=3)
036@UML(identifier="DQ_EvaluationMethodTypeCode", specification=ISO_19157)
037public final class EvaluationMethodType extends CodeList<EvaluationMethodType> {
038    /**
039     * Serial number for compatibility with different versions.
040     */
041    private static final long serialVersionUID = -2481257874205996202L;
042
043    /**
044     * Method of evaluating the quality of a data set based on inspection of items within
045     * the data set, where all data required is internal to the data set being evaluated.
046     */
047    @UML(identifier="directInternal", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19157)
048    public static final EvaluationMethodType DIRECT_INTERNAL = new EvaluationMethodType("DIRECT_INTERNAL");
049
050    /**
051     * Method of evaluating the quality of a data set based on inspection of items within
052     * the data set, where reference data external to the data set being evaluated is required.
053     */
054    @UML(identifier="directExternal", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19157)
055    public static final EvaluationMethodType DIRECT_EXTERNAL = new EvaluationMethodType("DIRECT_EXTERNAL");
056
057    /**
058     * Method of evaluating the quality of a data set based on external knowledge.
059     */
060    @UML(identifier="indirect", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19157)
061    public static final EvaluationMethodType INDIRECT = new EvaluationMethodType("INDIRECT");
062
063    /**
064     * Constructs an element of the given name.
065     *
066     * @param name  the name of the new element. This name shall not be in use by another element of this type.
067     */
068    private EvaluationMethodType(final String name) {
069        super(name);
070    }
071
072    /**
073     * Returns the list of {@code EvaluationMethodType}s.
074     *
075     * @return the list of codes declared in the current JVM.
076     */
077    public static EvaluationMethodType[] values() {
078        return values(EvaluationMethodType.class);
079    }
080
081    /**
082     * Returns the list of codes of the same kind as this code list element.
083     * Invoking this method is equivalent to invoking {@link #values()}, except that
084     * this method can be invoked on an instance of the parent {@code CodeList} class.
085     *
086     * @return all code {@linkplain #values() values} for this code list.
087     */
088    @Override
089    public EvaluationMethodType[] family() {
090        return values();
091    }
092
093    /**
094     * Returns the evaluation method type that matches the given string, or returns a new one if none match it.
095     * This methods returns the first instance (in declaration order) for which the {@linkplain #name() name}
096     * is {@linkplain String#equalsIgnoreCase(String) equals, ignoring case}, to the given name.
097     * If no existing instance is found, then a new one is created for the given name.
098     *
099     * @param  code  the name of the code to fetch or to create.
100     * @return a code matching the given name.
101     */
102    public static EvaluationMethodType valueOf(String code) {
103        return valueOf(EvaluationMethodType.class, code, EvaluationMethodType::new).get();
104    }
105}
